about.engagementText1: With over 5 years of experience in immigration law, I put my expertise at the service of individuals and businesses to support them in their residence, settlement and naturalization projects in France.
about.engagementText2: My approach is characterized by attentive listening, rigorous legal analysis and personalized support adapted to each situation. I firmly believe that everyone deserves a chance to succeed in their life project in France, and I am committed to defending your rights with determination and professionalism.

residencePermits.title: Residence Permits
residencePermits.description: Regularization request, renewal, status change and family reunification.
residencePermits.subtitle: Obtaining and renewing your right to stay
residencePermits.detailedDescription: We assist you in preparing your file and represent you before the prefectures to secure your administrative situation in France.
items: Residence permits for professional reasons (employee, talent passport)

nationality.title: French Nationality
nationality.description: Naturalization procedures by decree, marriage or declaration.
nationality.subtitle: Becoming a French citizen
nationality.detailedDescription: Acquiring French nationality is a major step. We guide you through the different procedures to maximize your chances of success.
items: Preparation of naturalization files by decree
Declaration of nationality based on birth and residence in France
Appeals against deferral or rejection decisions

litigation.title: Litigation & Appeals
litigation.description: Defense against deportation orders, visa refusals and litigation before administrative courts.
litigation.subtitle: Defending your rights before the courts
litigation.detailedDescription: Faced with an unfavorable administrative decision, rapid and strategic action is essential. We defend you tenaciously before administrative courts.
items: Appeals against Orders to Leave French Territory (OQTF)
Contesting refusals of residence permits and renewal refusals
Litigation regarding placement in administrative detention and residence assignments
